title: Government Fund Accountant
description:
**Position Summary:**

The Government Fund Accountant will report to the Director of Finance and will be responsible for performing advanced accounting and financial reporting functions to ensure the proper management and compliance of public funds. This position plays a key role in preparing and maintaining governmental fund financial records in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) guidelines, and relevant federal, state, and local regulations.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Maintain the general ledger and sub-ledgers for governmental funds (e.g., General Fund, Special Revenue Funds, Capital Projects, Debt Service, Enterprise Funds).
* Process bi-weekly payroll in conformance with state and federal tax laws.
* Reconcile employee benefit invoices and ensure proper and timely payment.
* Create all manual journal entries.
* Create all ACH payment files and wire transfers for payroll and accounts payable.
* Create and update all accounting schedules, and payment/revenue tracking spreadsheets.
* Post monthly property tax distribution payments for City and Urban Renewal Authority.
* Submit monthly financial information to URAD accountant in a timely manner.
* Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports.
* Provide financial analysis and reporting for elected officials and department directors as requested.
* Oversee the reconciliation of bank accounts, investment accounts, and other financial records.
* Oversee sales tax collection operations and make audit recommendations as needed.
* Analyze fund activity and ensure proper classification and posting of revenues, expenditures, assets, and liabilities.
* Assist in the development of the annual budget and monitor fund balances and budget compliance throughout the fiscal year.
* Assist and support the annual audit process, including the preparation of audit schedules and working with external auditors in conjunction with the Director of Finance.
* Participate in the implementation and maintenance of financial systems, including ERP platforms.
* Assist with internal controls, policies, and procedures related to fund accounting.
* Provide financial reporting support for grants and other externally funded programs.
* Train and provide guidance to junior accounting staff.
* Ensure compliance with GASB, GAAP, and applicable laws and regulations.
* Other duties as directed by supervisor.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Strong understanding of governmental fund accounting principles and practices.
* Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Excel; experience with ERP systems is preferred.
* Ability to analyze complex financial data and produce accurate reports.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills for reporting to elected officials, department directors, and citizens.
* Ability to work independently or in a team environment as needed.
* Ability to multi-task.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, Public Administration, or a related field or associate’s degree in accounting plus a minimum of 3 years of experience in governmental accounting or fund accounting (local or state government preferred).
* CPA or CGFM certification is a plus.

* Experience with design verification and validation, including the use of statistical analysis.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

RRC CORE VALUES

Client Satisfaction – understands the goal of always exceeding our client’s expectations  
Employee Happiness – able to work well with others, communicate clearly with coworkers, promote a positive work environment, and mediate conflicts between team members  
Quality Work - able to take ownership, work independently, prioritize workload, and deliver quality results on time while working on multiple projects simultaneously  
Above and Beyond - versatile, flexible, able to anticipate the needs of the company, take the initiative, and willing to go out of your way to assist others

Provide SCADA expertise on wind, battery, solar and PV + Storage power systems during the design, development, implementation, and commissioning phases of each project.  
Design and deploy wind energy, solar, and battery storage SCADA systems.  
Work with project manager to deliver procurement and deployment plans, timelines, and costs.  
Work with and manage clients to ensure requirements and expectations are clear.  
Manage IT consultants and subcontractors for network security deliverables, testing, budgets, and system completion.  
Coordinate project site TELCO installation, scheduling and manage schedules and owners expectation.  
Deploy SCADA solutions according to timelines and budget. Troubleshoot problems until site requirements are met.

Work closely with the clients team, as well as RRC project manager, and project engineer to warranty a quality system is installed and tested to design specifications.

Responsible to ensure SAFETY requirements are met.

Experience with SCADA software programming, SCADA historians, MS SQL servers.  
Experience with Inductive Automation Ignition 7.x or 8.x software a must.  
Experience with communication protocols for base-level devices: Modbus, Modbus TCP, OPC, DNP3, SELFast, IEC 61850, ICCP etc.  
Experience with automation control systems: RTAC programming, Rockwell PLC and Control Logix programming (a plus)  
Experience with automation device integration  
Experience with BESS EMS system (a plus)  
Experience with complete SCADA system project life cycles  
Experience with Power Utility scale SCADA system development and design  
Experience with FAT and SAT testing and documentation  
Working knowledge of Utility Meters, Substation RTAC, Protection Relays  
Knowledge of NERC CIP requirements  
Knowledge of Managed switches, Hirschmans, MOXA, Ciscoetc.  
Knowledge of Power Plant Networking, Security and Firewalls

QUALIFICATIONS

BS degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering  
Minimum 3 or more years of proven utility or industrial SCADA experience.  
Ability to communicate complex SCADA and controls concepts to non-domain experts in a collaborative fashion.  
Working knowledge of the renewable energy industry and projects a plus.  
Familiarity with and able to stay current on SCADA regulations and standards.  
Travel 25%
